title: How did you get out of Bronze?
body: Tell your experiences to a little bronzie like me thats just trying to survive in the blizzard of flamers.

replies.body: Ranked #1 OCE Challenger; Shernfire who plays for the OCE Direwolves professionally says: that if you are decent at Katarina, she can get you from Bronze to at least Master tier. Just make sure you get all the kills and carry your team and you win.
Problem is, she's banned in literally every game in bronze.. (everyone thinks shes op lol)

...because she is...she is banned in almost every game everywhere....or not banned so she can be picked.

EDIT: or intentionally counterpicked, coaxing the enemy into picking her.

The best way to start working your way up is starting with the fundamentals.
1. Ward.
2. Watch your minimap.
3. Use your pings
4. Listen to pings.
5. Farm.
6. Mute toxic players soon as you get even the slightest hint that you might hate that guy in the next 5 mins.
7. Farm.
8. Don't turn into a toxic player that people have to mute.
9. Farm.
10. Farm. Seriously there's a reason why the best players in the pro-leagues are the ones with the best CS/10. Before I'd start any sort of ranked run for the evening I used to hit up a bot game and just practice last hitting for a few minutes. It pays off when you're 2 or 3 waves ahead on CS when you eventually start trading.

Easiest way to get out of bronze....


Freelo: {{champion:11}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:14}}

> [{quoted}](name=Ekrah,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=kd8E6WYO,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-04-20T16:24:06.104+0000)

> Easiest way to get out of bronze....

> Freelo: {{champion:11}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:14}}

Add volibear.
{{champion:106}}

the best thing to do in any pvp game, is whenever you make a mistake, write it down and then after a game or w/e go over your notes and work out how you could fix everything you did wrong

edit(2):

One thing that can really help is learning 1-2 specific characters and focus on 1 role (top,adc,support etc) and getting really good at one thing, that's what a lot of top players do.

just a few things you do work on: (mostly based on my experience as a cc support)

- was your laning positioning correct?
- did you poke effectively?
- did you ward well?
- were you warding the right places?
- did I contribute enough in a team fight?
- am I doing the right thing in a team fight?
- was I at the right place on the map at the right time (dragon / baron objective contesting)
- did I pick the right champion against x matchup
- was my item build acceptable for the enemy matchup
- am I using my skills correctly
- am I overlapping cc when I could get an extra 0.2-0.5 seconds out of it

there are many many many more things you can work on such as spacing etc but it's a lot of detail and you'll learn it all in time, play lots and learn.

edit: also learn to take advice, most people don't take advice well.
I might print this off, laminate it and stick it on the wall beside the monitor, this a gold mate. No wait Diamond. Cheers and TY.

Thanks for you help :3
This actually sounds like an awesome thing to do

Sorry, I dont want to be hated by the entire league of legends comunity.

Play the most skill deficient, brain-dead easy champions there is.

Like Lee Sin, Riven and Tristana.
Tristana takes more skill then you think.
sorry can't hear you over my katarina, akali, and yi

from the words of literally every high rank streamer and pro player in a non-OCE environment: no one in bronze can play lee sin.

riven is pretty easy and freelo, but apart from scaring the shit out of the enemy team into surrendering, it does get a bit hard to 1 vs 5 a team with her without knowing how to use her. even in bronze.

trist is a hypercarry. but she sure isnt braindead easy. a better tip would be to use early game dominant champs and get a CS lead. a massive CS lead. oh and try not to die.
I duo'd with people. I'd play ranked and duo with someone who is similiar skill level.. once i got to silver i solo'd again.

got placed in bronze 3, then didn't play ranked for about 5 months because i had ranked anxiety, then i spammed ranked and got from bronze 3 to silver 1 in about 2 weeks, that's about it, this was last season.

The thing that i find people doing the most in bronze is chasing for kills. They push some low health enemies out of lane then keep chasing into no vision bushes and jungle. Of course they meet a welcoming party and all die. So they died and wasted 30-60 seconds, and got no map pressure or objectives at all.
Take some advice from teammates not to do it, and listen to pings. Objectives win games, not kills.

I was never in bronze last season. Simple.
This season, is a different story.
